definitions.example: The diver pierced the surface of the water with scarcely a splash.

definitions.definition: To create a hole in the skin for the purpose of inserting jewelry
definitions.example: Can you believe he pierced his tongue?

definitions.definition: To get to the heart or crux of (a matter).
The action of the verb to pierce.
A hole made in the body so that jewellery/jewelry can be worn through it.
An item of jewelry designed to be fitted through a piercing.
Appearing to look deeply into; penetrating.
Of temperature, extremely cold so that it penetrates through clothing and shelter.
Of sound, loud and sharp; shrill.
definitions.example: The piercing noise of the children could be heard two blocks from the elementary school.
